titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Isaac-Interfaith Strategy for Advocacy and Action in the Community records

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

persname.primary_name: Isaac-Interfaith Strategy for Advocacy and Action in the Community.

did.unittitle: Isaac-Interfaith Strategy for Advocacy and Action in the Community records

descgrp.accessrestrict: The collection is open for research use.

archdesc.bioghist: Congregation-centered organization, headquartered in Kalamazoo and serving the Michigan counties of Kalamazoo, Barry, Allegan, Van Buren, St. Joseph, Berrien, Cass, Calhoun, Branch, Jackson, Hillsdale, and Lewanee.
archdesc.scopecontent: Issues of concern to the organization included housing for the poor; health, education, and other needs of children and youth; and the need for greater regional cooperation on common problems. By-laws, newsletters, resources guide, banquet programs, and informational literature.

persname.primary_name: Isaac-Interfaith Strategy for Advocacy and Action in the Community.
